website_summaries.verdict: Great choice if you can bring the tile work to the saw (not the saw to the work). Powerful motor and strong blades make short work of most tile cutting jobs. Good water collection-return system.
pros: Plunge cut option very useful for special cuts
Water recovery and return trays minimize mess
cons: Cart sometimes wobbles, making accurate cuts a challenge
Heavy and bulky, not easily portable

customer_reviews.title: My fist D24000 was a great saw for 8 years.
customer_reviews.text: I have been in the tile business for 31 years, and have owned or operated just about every brand made during that span. I just purchased my second D24000 after the bearings started going bad after 8 years of use. The reasons I like this saw are, the light weight and portability of the unit, water containment ability, and the good power and accuracy of the unit. I saw some of the reviews from other tile tradesmen that said their second unit wasn't of the same quality. I decided to roll the dice and hope I get one that gives me a similar period of use.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best tile saw ever!
customer_reviews.text: Having previously used two other brands of tile saws for cutting sandstone, I am very please with the quality and design of the DeWalt 2400 saw. I used the suggested method of placing the water pump in a separate 5 gallon bucket rather than let it sit in the tank. I attached a drain hose to the catch basin drain so the dirty water flows out continuously, these two steps makes cleanup very easy and extends the life of the saw significantly.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory W. Hart

customer_reviews.title: Used, returned product?
customer_reviews.text: 1 star on product delivered, because, I finally got to open the box to put this together for our remodeling project, and: 1. Arrived with scratches and nics (did someone return this and then it was shipped out again? Don't know but wondering if that's the case...) 2. Per the instructions manual, p. 2, a GFCI should be included but was nowhere to be found... Unless I'm missing something. ... Will edit/update this review if anything else requires a comment, is missing, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Bookworm

customer_reviews.title: Burns out Diamond Blades in a dozen 6" Cuts
customer_reviews.text: Chips tile, burns through blades. 6Arrived out of line, "Requiring" parallel adjustment. Service center says to bring it in... It's Brand New!!! I do not want to lose weeks for service. Tile carriage jumps twice on each pass, breaking off last 1/2 inch of time. Looks like it Should be excellent; Performs much worse than our cheap 7" from HD. We've spent HOURS trying to get it ti work. DeWalt: Please HELP!
customer_reviews.author: Earl

customer_reviews.title: Front Bearings Pass End of Guides?
customer_reviews.text: This would have been an awesome saw, BUT! The front bearings pass the end of the guides which causes the table to bump. After the table bearings pass the end of the guides; table then has side to side movement. The guides should have been extended 4-1/2 inches longer, then this would be an awesome tile saw.
customer_reviews.author: Coffee, lunch and crab

customer_reviews.title: Great saw.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this saw about a month ago in the middle of a bathroom remodel I was doing. The saw perform great. I have used a small bench top saw for years. I wish I had bought this along time ago. The only complaint i have is the overview for the saw makes it sound like you don't get a blade with the saw but you do. So don't buy the extra blade like I did
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Awesome wet saw
customer_reviews.text: really nice table sliding wet saw. As with another comment, would recommend using two 5gal buckets (one for fresh water supply and one for dirty water from drain area.) Comes with a blade but purchased a Dewalt DW4762 blade for cutting porcelain tile. The DW4762 is a solid blade (no relief or J slots cuts with the included blade) cuts the porcelain better. Had to make a few minor adjustments out of the box (squaring blade to 90deg, table slide and stand height. very easy to do. cutting 12"x24" porcelain tile.
customer_reviews.author: Jill

customer_reviews.title: Not What I Expected
customer_reviews.text: The saw came in a very nice box. I was really looking forward to the versitility of this saw. The table seemed very stable and the cutting dimensions made this a winner however the motor crapped out after 4 jobs rendering this amazing looking saw useless. I immediately had to purchase another saw to complete the job. Boo Dewalt! I still own and use daily there 10" slide compound miter and 10" table saw so there not all crap but that was an exercise I wouldn't do again.
customer_reviews.author: glenn

customer_reviews.title: Dewalt Wet Saw Review
customer_reviews.text: It worked well for about 50 cuts of 1/2 inch marble 12x24. Once I changed the blade with an identical dewalt part, the motor started to vibrate after 15 cuts and caused rough cuts and chipping. I checked all the bolts, blade and the ground for leveling. Could not see why this is happening. I reached out to dewalt for customer service, no help. They sent me an email to review the owners manual for for trouble shooting. Not sure what to make of their response other then complete disappointment. Save your money and don’t buy this wet saw.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: good cutting capacity
customer_reviews.text: This is a Cadillac of a tilesaw, smooth sliding table, adjustable to true the table to the blade, good cutting capacity, and an awesome water delivery. I love mine, just wish it were 20lbs lighter. You can cut with this saw and not have to put down plastic, the water retention trays work well.
customer_reviews.author: Mathew T.

customer_reviews.title: Engineered for Tradesmen
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my buddy in exchange for some tile labor and I can assure you; this saw is engineered for tradesmen. It is heavy (solid as a rock) but still quite portable. Locking guide is worth its weight in gold because it allows precise and repeatable rips and angle cuts. I don't see any room for improvement unless it were all magnesium to reduce the weight.
customer_reviews.author: John Koehler

customer_reviews.title: which works great still, and then I upgraded to a Kobalt ...
customer_reviews.text: I am a remodeling contractor and doing about 3000-5000 sqft of tile work a year, so the for the past several years I have used a small craftsman, which works great still, and then I upgraded to a Kobalt unit, which constantly had side-tracking issues. I researched quite a bit before making this purchase and when it came down to it, I went with what I know from experience...Dewalt makes great tools. This unit is no exception. Works perfectly every time I use it. It is somewhat cumbersome with all the pieces, but I only bring it when I'm doing a large job, so set-up time is not that big of a deal.
customer_reviews.author: Stonemug

customer_reviews.title: ... not a professional but this saw makes you feel like you could become one
customer_reviews.text: I'm not a professional but this saw makes you feel like you could become one. Makes cutting tile a breeze. I graduated from a small MK 7" saw that was a little undersized for the 24" tile that my latest project called for. The table on this saw moves smoothly on the guide rails and the water trays are great for keeping the water where you want it. The drain plug is perfectly located so that you can place a 5 gallon bucket underneath for easy cleanup after you're done.
customer_reviews.author: Nana Banana

customer_reviews.title: The beauty of Dewalt
customer_reviews.text: I almost bought the Ridgid 10 in wet tile saw since there was a deal at Homedepot. Fortunately I found this one on Amazon since doing research what's the best wet tile saw on the market. Many complaints about Ridgid one but less complaints about this Dewalt. More likely there are more satisfaction and happiness with this one from many users. I like it because of its accuracy, easy to set up, and its power. I have used it with few projects now, cutting from porcelain to stone panel with an ease. If you do want a good wet tile saw as a DIY or handyman, I do recommend this one.
customer_reviews.author: tool_lover

customer_reviews.title: Great Saw---But get a different blade!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great saw but the Dewalt blade that comes with it does not work well on porcelain----it shakes too much and the cut is not smooth. I just bought a diamond blade from another company and although it cost me $50 more dollars, it is worth it NOT to use the Dewalt blade. The saw is great---works well and is easy to set up and clean!
customer_reviews.author: Mike W.

customer_reviews.title: Machine is only as good as it's weakest part.
customer_reviews.text: The saw motor runs great and functions well. The sliding tray fixture drops as it rolls towards the blade due the roller bearings not level when mounted to the plate causing chips in the tile. The water pump worked great the first day but as soon as the cheap plastic shield fell off, the blades broke and the pump no longer functions. I would think for the price of the machine there would more a durable water pump system.
customer_reviews.author: mark v

customer_reviews.title: Does everything it’s supposed to
customer_reviews.text: I’ve made about 1000 cuts on this so far. Still have the original blade. Pros: Very efficient in water containment Pump has never clogged Tray and saw are easy to place Slides very smooth and precise. Cons: Saw doesn’t sit secure in tray. Only has two slots to set in Pump sits in odd space toward the front. I wish it was in the back.
customer_reviews.author: Taylor Mullinix

customer_reviews.title: Best Tile Saw I Have Ever Used
customer_reviews.text: This is a workhorse. I used this on a big bathroom project with thick travertine and it cut the tile perfectly square and with ease. The wide table allows you to cut huge tiles and the built in speed square was a nice addition. Easily cuts angles. Buy the pop up stand to go with this and you are in business.
customer_reviews.author: shawn p gallagher

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful saw
customer_reviews.text: This saw replaced a different brand saw that was driving us crazy trying to get straight cuts on large stone tiles. In comparison this saw was a dream! It cut through 12x24 travertine, limestone, and quartzite as though through paper, and was accurate without any effort on our part. It turned a job that had become a nightmare into fun.
customer_reviews.author: Colleen Johnson

customer_reviews.title: My Third Wet Saw And By Far The Best
customer_reviews.text: My third wet saw in 10 years of tile setting and by far the best. Cut 2' rips within 1/16th" right out of the box. I had to re calibrate my MK every time I set it up. The 30 pound weight difference is what really makes me smile. I've had the Dewalt for a year now and only have good things to say about it. Powerful motor, well engineered splash guards, even the factory blade was decent.
customer_reviews.author: cv hallady

customer_reviews.title: I was a little nervous after reading some of the other reviews about a bad bearing as the saw was going to show up ...
customer_reviews.text: I did a lot of research before buying this saw. I was a little nervous after reading some of the other reviews about a bad bearing as the saw was going to show up on Tuesday and my crew on Wednesday. Turns out this saw is great. We cut concrete pavers all day long. It is accurate, easy to use and almost zero over splash. The table size is huge and allowed us to cut all the pavers at any angle. It has more adjustments then I'll ever use. I highly recommend this saw.
customer_reviews.author: Harriet Parker

customer_reviews.title: Great saw and very accurate cuts
customer_reviews.text: The only reason I gave it four stars is the first saw I received had a bad vibration. But amazon customer service was awesome, they replaced it within a day. Now about the saw it self it’s grate. I used it for porcelain glass and natural stone. It cut 3/8 Italian porcelain tile like a champ. Would definitely recommend
customer_reviews.author: Adam Afzal

customer_reviews.title: Hands down #1 tile saw!
customer_reviews.text: Custom home builder and avid tile setter. Absolutely love this saw. I have owned much more expensive saws but this takes the cake. Very well made and accurate cutting out of the box, good pump, the water pan/return tray is a great design also. Work alone sometimes and the disassembly of this saw makes it manageable to carry. Haven't had any problems in 3 years of regular use. Even use it for cutting pavers, cap block, rock, synthetic stone, etc. Works great and would highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: k.Benfiel

customer_reviews.title: Great Pro Saw
customer_reviews.text: First off, this is a very nice saw...I've used MK for 20 plus years. This saw is also very large, which helps with overspray. This saw also has a very nice glide system and cuts smoothly. The DeWalt blade that came with it was OK, but will be replaced with a Razor. After a bit of a learning curve, it cuts great, breaks down well, but takes up a lot of room in my cargo trailer. Still a nice saw at a great price.
customer_reviews.author: Big Al

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to set up and use ..
customer_reviews.text: Used it the first time this weekend .. easy to set up .. had it set up in 30 mins. Out of the box.. future set ups 10 min. 100% happy with this saw .. small adjustment to the blade and it cuts perfect .. i have the water pump in clean water verse in tray .. wish i bought this saw a lot sooner ..
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Hochstetter

customer_reviews.title: I like this saw
customer_reviews.text: I was looking at the Bosch and this one and could have gone either way, frankly. This came with the stand so I bought it. I've used it for several jobs and am happy with it. To those who complain about the pump I say: flush it out and it will last. When cleaning up I put the pump in a 5 gal pail of clean water and pump it through.
customer_reviews.author: chris

customer_reviews.title: A great wet saw!
customer_reviews.text: It wasn't cheap but it cuts accurately and powered through the several boxes of ledger,stone panels I needed to install. I look forward to,some paver projects and veneering an outdoor fireplace using this great saw this summer. It is a joy to do projects when you have the right tool,,and if you have tiles, pavers, or stint to cut, this IS the right too Long!
customer_reviews.author: Matthew D. Bowers

customer_reviews.title: Great saw.
customer_reviews.text: Works great. I'm a contractor, and love this thing. My only complaint might be the water volume control - it's some sort of hose clamp with notches, doesn't give you much variable control. It still get's 5 stars. It cut true out of the box, which is nice.
customer_reviews.author: Bullfrog77

customer_reviews.title: Among the best for sure.
customer_reviews.text: Buying the right blade and being familiar w timing makes this an excellent machine. Better than the orange or blue ones I’ve used from big box stores.
customer_reviews.author: Gary

customer_reviews.title: Great saw
customer_reviews.text: I researched saws for a LONG time and landed on this saw. Used it for three home jobs and love it. I would suggest improving the water pump as the blade break off of you don't transport it (pump) carefully. Lost two of four blades, now I don't get enough water and you can't just buy the propeller. LOVE the SAW! Hate the pump
customer_reviews.author: Klok

customer_reviews.title: Great saw!
customer_reviews.text: This saw is amazing! It is extremely versatile with all the options it provides. The plunge cut is very handy. The rolling tray is smooth and stays true to the blade with no play. I've already cut ceramic, porcelain, marble, natural stone and glass. I pulled off some tricky cuts that other saws couldn't have so easily. Definitely worth the money and highly recommend. The single down side I noticed was sometimes the pump takes a while to reprime for the first use of the day.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: When I opened the box I was thoroughly impressed with the beautifully crafted parts and quality of this wet saw. Big and heavy... but it needs to be for cutting larger sized tile. I needed it for 2’ x 2’ x 1/2 tiles that is impossible on a little standard tile saw which I also own one of. Proud to own this saw! I hope DeWalt doesn’t go down the same road as Hitachi and cheap out to China. Love this saw!
customer_reviews.author: Jamie

customer_reviews.title: Pump problem with 3 months old saw
customer_reviews.text: Bought a saw in october, did one bathroom. Try to start saw now and: pump doesn’t pumping water, outlet between machine and pump is not working. Connected pump from other power source.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: In my husband's opinion, the best tile and rock cutting saw he's ever used.
customer_reviews.text: My husband is very pleased with the performance of the saw and the accuracy. He cut rock and tile with it and it is very accurate.
customer_reviews.author: Sue D. Mackenzie

customer_reviews.title: Great saw, very smooth and clean operating (very little ...
customer_reviews.text: Great saw, very smooth and clean operating (very little mist makes it past the rubber boots, and the tray setup works great for returning to the tray any water that might run off the larger tiles. Quieter than I expected because of one review I had read somewhere, much quieter than my 7" bridge saw. The only improvement will be a different blade, there are better blades out there for about the same price as a stock replacement blade would cost, Sets up real fast (less than a minute) after you've put it together for the first time,
customer_reviews.author: dsconstructs

customer_reviews.title: Nice wet saw.
customer_reviews.text: Very nice wet saw. Very accurate right out of the box. Very little, if any, overspray. Kind of a pain to clean the pan. Make sure you fill a 5 gallon bucket with water, set it next to the saw and place the pump in the bucket of water. Don't bother loading the tray with water and placing the pump in the tray.
customer_reviews.author: Scooter

customer_reviews.title: Great Pro saw
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the best tools I own. Had it for about 6 months and I can't think of a single complaint. That's a great thing. I'm upgraded many saws but this is the one I'm going to stick with. Great Pro saw
customer_reviews.author: Paul Y.

customer_reviews.title: Best saw ever!
customer_reviews.text: My husband exact words "this is the best saw ever, and it cuts so smooth and effortless is like cutting on butter! Lol! He's very happy with this purchase really recommend product and seller A+
customer_reviews.author: Alma

customer_reviews.title: An excellent, excellent saw
customer_reviews.text: An excellent, excellent saw! Paid for itself after the first or second job I used it on. Very powerful motor, which means it can cleanly cut tile with ease and lack of dragging itself down. Accurate and well built. Easy and fast to switch back and forth between 90 and 45 degree cuts. Good water containment system for jobs where you have to be concerned about that detail. Easy to set up, easy to clean up. I love bidding tile jobs now because I know the saw will hold up to the task.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Hilton

customer_reviews.title: Buy this tile saw!
customer_reviews.text: In order to precisely cut porcelain, natural stones , or ceramics, a certain amount of mass and momentum are needed along with consistent blade speed. The DeWalt , by default, is necessarily hefty . However, it's design allows easy set up despite its weight. It is a delight to use and has made all of my tile work much easier. I am primarily a bathroom remodeler and use this saw very frequently. By far, this is the best designed, easiest to assemble, labor facilitating, and accurate cutting tile saw I have owned. All of that costs a bit, but is well worth the price in consideration of how well this saw performs.
customer_reviews.author: ebock

customer_reviews.title: I love this thing
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing. Pricey but you wont regret it if you even end up doing a couple of tile jobs. Suckers heavy though, but definitely built well. If you store it some where below freezing make sure you disconnect the water hose and manually blow air through the line to clear water out of the pump. I usually just do it with my mouth and It hasn't broken yet.
customer_reviews.author: nils

customer_reviews.title: Great saw
customer_reviews.text: Great saw. Large enough, light enough, smooth table, spill trays keep water in
customer_reviews.author: Philip M.

customer_reviews.title: Works like a workhorse
customer_reviews.text: The unit was accurate and sturdy. It kept the messs to minimum. I wish the stand had wheels.
customer_reviews.author: w.ri

customer_reviews.title: My tile saw is inaccurate, 1/16 in 6”
customer_reviews.text: It wobbles and doesn’t cut a straight 1/16 in 6 inch and 3/16 in 12 , I hope that Dewalt will fix it
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Great saw
customer_reviews.text: Been doing tile for 25 yrs. One the best quiets saws if have used.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew S.

customer_reviews.title: The sky the's  limit
customer_reviews.text: I've been doing tile for over twenty years & this saw is an absolute beast ! This is a professional tool that gives professional results I whole heartedly recommend as it is well constructed & light weight
customer_reviews.author: REXILYNN

customer_reviews.title: Very good choice for my Business.
customer_reviews.text: This saw has met and or exceeded my expectations so far. It has plenty of power even for thick porcelain tile that i use regularly. It cuts straight which is of extreme importance, since I use it to make a living. I have used it now on 3 big tile jobs and thus far I am very pleased. I wouldn't recommend it for weekenders because of the price, but other than that I would highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Box

customer_reviews.title: Best tile saw I ever used
customer_reviews.text: Easy to setup. Easy to use. Cuts 24” tile no problem. Great Saw.
customer_reviews.author: Internet Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Bought it for my fiance
customer_reviews.text: My man howled with delight when he opened this on xmas morning. It can handle hard to cut materials, and is considered the gold standard. Unfortunately, I ordered this for the holidays, and the first shipment was lost. It comes in Dewalt packaging, and is extremely large and heavy, so don't even thing about trying to fit it in the trunk of a car. Also, it came with a crack in the body, so I wasn't thrilled about that either.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie

customer_reviews.title: As a professional tile setter, most important thing is ...
customer_reviews.text: As a professional tile setter, most important thing is how accurate i can cut tile exactly where i want to and it meets my needs perfectly. So i have to give five star with confidence to future prospect.
customer_reviews.author: Akira

customer_reviews.title: Handles the big pieces
customer_reviews.text: This saw had no problem cutting my large, heavy 24" x 12" x 3" capstones. The extension table was too small / lightweight for such weight and size, but understandable and not a problem when used in conjunction with a roller table. Made a variety of cuts from 90 degrees to 12.25 degrees. Excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Solograham

customer_reviews.title: Awesome saw!
customer_reviews.text: I love DeWalt products although they are quite pricey but well worth the money. The manual for assembly is not very well defined as the other manuals I have for my other DeWalt products. I had to watch the YouTube video to make sure I was assembling the machine correctly. There was a missing hex wrench in my purchase. The wet saw itself is awesome and it is so easy to use. I love this saw!
customer_reviews.author: Janna Armstrong

customer_reviews.title: works great other than
customer_reviews.text: Heavy, still I rate, extremely awkward to carry.. chords could have been made more functional for moving and transport. No quick disconnect.. works great other than that
customer_reviews.author: Gesture

customer_reviews.title: This is it!
customer_reviews.text: My husband is a professional tile installer. A 35 year veteran of the tile and stone trade. He says "someone was really thinking when they designed this saw". Excellent cuts, spray guards, wider table area for large tiles and more! He is very particular and pleased. For installers out there who want a professional grade tile saw, this is it!
customer_reviews.author: Krista R. Meyer

customer_reviews.title: Better than most.....not the best.
customer_reviews.text: Ok for what it is. Sad that they dont use all stainless fasteners on a too that has water on it all the time.
customer_reviews.author: UNACAMPER

customer_reviews.title: Professional Grade
customer_reviews.text: Well made and professional grade. Perfect for the professional or advanced DIYer.
customer_reviews.author: fccinAZ

customer_reviews.title: Well built and Designed
customer_reviews.text: I would recommend this saw to any serious installers,as it is pricey but well worth it.I have used this saw indoors and it does great job of keeping water in pan but still use plastic at back to contain mist. Overall just a great tool.I have had this saw for a few years now and no problems.
customer_reviews.author: G.C.

customer_reviews.title: Best in the Business
customer_reviews.text: What can you say other than, it's the best in the business.
customer_reviews.author: GBurke

customer_reviews.title: Great saw!
customer_reviews.text: For the tile work I needed to do on my house I had had enough of buying the cheap tile saws so I bought this. It's smooth and cuts beautifully. The only downside compared to other nice saws that I have used: It is loud. Other good saws that I have used have larger motors are considerably quieter. But aside from that, it is awesome!
customer_reviews.author: Travis Gagnon

customer_reviews.title: Awesome tile saw
customer_reviews.text: Cut fast, light weight, easy to move around, and this is professional tool that you should buy,
customer_reviews.author: hsin yu wang

customer_reviews.title: DeWalt D24000 Tile Saw
customer_reviews.text: I am not a professional tile/stone installer but consider myself a do-it-yourself No Fear kind of guy. This saw meets my every expectation. Its' cuts are precise, the saw is inherently stable, (on top of my B&D ShopMate), is vibrationless,...yada yada yada. I do not expect to transport it from job to job or use it on a daily basis. But if you expect to do your own bathroom/kitchen tile work, stone facia, etc, I don't believe you need to spend more or buy another wet tile saw ever again.
customer_reviews.author: mbw

customer_reviews.title: Happy Husband
customer_reviews.text: The blade is not that good but other than that my husband was very pleased!
customer_reviews.author: Rita

customer_reviews.title: I like the dewalt the most
customer_reviews.text: I have used all the big name saws. I like the dewalt the most. I hate the rigid. I def. hate the Bosch. Even like it better than the MK saws.
customer_reviews.author: Chris S. DellaCroce

customer_reviews.title: 5 stars
customer_reviews.text: Works great as expected, easy setup. I put aftermarket blade on first thing.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: dewalt tile saw
customer_reviews.text: Great tile saw this is my second dewalt saw. last lasted over 10 years with some small repairs along the way
customer_reviews.author: Rob Hughey

customer_reviews.title: Yellow strikes again with a winner
customer_reviews.text: Have used several other wet saws over the years and this is for the $$ worth every penny (Dollar) as it sets up and stores with out killing your back. Don't get me wrong this is no light weight machine it just can be moved in sections with the motor and guild assembly being the only heavy part. If you are looking at this just by it and save yourself a trip to return anything else.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Byrd

customer_reviews.title: That is about the best recommendation I can make
customer_reviews.text: We have 4 of these in our crystal mining and upgrading business. That is about the best recommendation I can make.
customer_reviews.author: Mark W. Hooper

customer_reviews.title: Very good saw
customer_reviews.text: Quite a decent saw for the money. I cut 20" tiles and it stayed true to the mark right to the end. No problems with the saw. Remember to run clean water through the pump after you finish for the day and you'll be set for the next day. I did a lot of research beforehand and am glad I bought it. The blade that comes with it doesn't last so have a new one ready to go.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie J

customer_reviews.title: Great saw. Very easy to set-up and use
customer_reviews.text: Great saw. Very easy to set-up and use. Quick tear down and clean up. Included blade is very nice as well. This is an excellent tile saw.
customer_reviews.author: Axel

customer_reviews.title: Awesome tool
customer_reviews.text: Best wet saw I have ever used. Very accurate and straight cutting. Even the included blade is very good. My only con is that the water tube is about 2 inches shorter then I would like. I use the pump in a fresh bucket of water and it don't reach bottom of bucket. Also the stand is very stable.
customer_reviews.author: Steven  Shaver

customer_reviews.title: Accurate, powerful, for every day user
customer_reviews.text: Might be the best portable wet saw out there. Just missing an easy way to get it around...
customer_reviews.author: Christopher C.

customer_reviews.title: Great saw
customer_reviews.text: Ive used this saw on small tile all the way to large stones and have had no problems. This saw is a beast. Easy to use and setup. I would recommend this saw over other saws. I would also recommend buying the stand as well. Its a back saver.
customer_reviews.author: Mark O'Connor

customer_reviews.title: Love this Saw
customer_reviews.text: This is a great wet saw and works very well. It is quite heavy, however, that would not deter me from purchasing again.
customer_reviews.author: Panama

customer_reviews.title: Great saw but youtube vid on tune up.
customer_reviews.text: Had to adjust left side guide rail to seat tight to tile saw tray/table wheels. To prevent slope on table.. other then that best saw ever bought.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle kattner

customer_reviews.title: Great saw. Great price from amazon
customer_reviews.text: Great saw. Great price from amazon. Most of the tile contractors I know ONLY use this saw. They put some thought into the design of this saw, its powerful and VERY accurate. Get the stand!!
customer_reviews.author: framer1

customer_reviews.title: This DeWalt saw kicks ass
customer_reviews.text: Excellent saw, collects splash. Yes it's LOUD! So get some ear protectors or headphones and you'll be good to go. Everything on the saw works well and as expected. Breaks down well and is not hard to move around.
customer_reviews.author: Thoughtful

customer_reviews.title: Saw is good. Blade is bad.
customer_reviews.text: The saw and the components are great. All works good. But the blade I received was not good at all which made me stress that I bought a bad saw. When I cut tile the vibrations were really bad. So I decided to change the blade and that resolved the problem. Kinda sad how I'm paying almost one thousand dollars for something and get a bad blade.
customer_reviews.author: vasyl fursyk

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Good quality saw. We researched and this was the best priced and best performance.
customer_reviews.author: S. Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Dewalt ROCKS
customer_reviews.text: If you want straight cuts this saw is for you I have tried many others but hands down best saw on the market
customer_reviews.author: Nashvilletwin

customer_reviews.title: it gets 3 stars from me because right away the ...
customer_reviews.text: it gets 3 stars from me because right away the water that comes out to wet blade stopped working. this must be a defect because another business owner i know has the same saw and had the same problem. if the water worked properly it would be a 5 star for sure
customer_reviews.author: Jesse

customer_reviews.title: Great company to buy from.
customer_reviews.text: Great cutting Saw. Did a concrete potion cuts, no problem. Onto bathroom tile This saw is heavy in weight. One person can handle it but it won’t be easy going through doors alone or stairways. Table stand is worth it for your knees.
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: TERRIFIC PIECE OF EQUIPMENT! 5 STARS!!
customer_reviews.text: The Dewalt D24000S is terrific!! Some people have wrote about the size and weight but when you are cutting tiles and pavers I would prefer to have a machine that has plenty of stability. There is minimal vibration and zero blade wobble and I was able to precisely cut and shave tiles like butter. Such a joy to have a piece of equipment that functions as advertised!
customer_reviews.author: rehab1

customer_reviews.title: Long lasting dependable tile saw
customer_reviews.text: This saw will be used on a daily basis in our tile installation business and will hopefully last as long as the last 2 we have owned Both made it almost 10 years Best saw I have ever owned
customer_reviews.author: William Stuart MacLaren

customer_reviews.title: 20' Tilework - no problems!!
customer_reviews.text: Having never cut tile before, I researched reviews and purchased this D24000 mid-November. It arrived within 4 days and was shipped and packaged just right. Cutting 20" ceramic tiles was a breeze - the only thing we (my dad & I) noticed is to make sure the water streams are directed to the saw-blade instead of onto the tile. The tubes move so watch that part. I'm extremely happy with the performance of DeWalt's D24000 and cleanup is done within 10 minutes! I don't have the stand and I don't need it. Sitting on my little cooler, cutting is just fine. Recommended investment for any do-it-yourselver to the semi-pro to?
customer_reviews.author: Jerome J. Manne

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: The only saw I use. I set tile professionally. This saw is a standard in the industry.
customer_reviews.author: Missy

customer_reviews.title: ... setting tile for 20 years and this saw is great. I would still be using the 2400 I ...
customer_reviews.text: Been setting tile for 20 years and this saw is great. I would still be using the 2400 I bought 7 years ago if not for tweaker thieves. Saw came perfectly square, shipping was great, no complaints
customer_reviews.author: Robert Philips

customer_reviews.title: ... on many jobs and this saw is just as good if not better
customer_reviews.text: I have used the MK101 pro saw on many jobs and this saw is just as good if not better. The cuts are accurate and it can handle large tiles. The stand that is sold separate is really a must with this saw.
customer_reviews.author: Phil

customer_reviews.title: Good Product !
customer_reviews.text: This saw is getting the job done and has a few attachments that come in handy. Cut a small room with marbled with no issues. Great Product !
customer_reviews.author: christopher j kaiser

customer_reviews.title: great
customer_reviews.text: For a DIY it is wonderful. used it to cut marble tile for a large backsplash. very reliable. easy to use. easy to set up. very good quality. worth the $$$
customer_reviews.author: bshilkitus

customer_reviews.title: Great saw!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent saw! Well worth the money. I was previously using a ridgid saw but got tired of the cuts being a 1/4 inch out of square in 12”. This saw cuts a 24” tile perfectly square!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cuts great
customer_reviews.text: This saw cut through a 1.5 inch granite slab like butter. Porcelain and glass tiles too, without chips. I'm a little disappointed in the slide rollers though, perhaps I can adjust them, but they don't all contact the rail, and results in a surge when the first wheels exit the rail. We're about halfway done with the shower and bathroom floor tiling, and it's running just like it did out of the box. Blade is just as good as this morning when I unboxed it.
customer_reviews.author: Ken K.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome saw
customer_reviews.text: I have been installing tile for 20 yrs. I love this saw. Light, easy set up. The rubber sliding table is great. Eliminates tile breaking of tile at the end of a cut. One possible improvement. A gravity folding stand with wheels would be great. Saved an hour or two on first job because it was so easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: D. Pasola

customer_reviews.title: Best tile saw ever
customer_reviews.text: I'm remodel contructor , I do have many dewalt tools on my job side , just got this saw two month ago for remodeling for My customer's home two bathrooms, I bought this tile saw because my client ordered lager tile 16''X24'' commercial tile.. very elegant, required high quailty, and accurate cut, dewalt D24000 tile saw , help my job so easy and very professional looks , it is light weight easy for set up.. I'm highly recommended this product to all people ,this is best tile tool on the marketing..
customer_reviews.author: TM contrctor

customer_reviews.title: Great investment
customer_reviews.text: Terrific saw for the money. You would be hard pressed to find a better saw at twice the price.
customer_reviews.author: Curtis

customer_reviews.title: the cuts that my helper were bringing me from outside were great.. I was on layout and only marking ...
customer_reviews.text: I just bought this for a tile job. It worked splendidly! Well.. the cuts that my helper were bringing me from outside were great.. I was on layout and only marking after the 2 test cuts. For ease of use and affordability I am very happy with my purchase!
customer_reviews.author: jared mcewen

customer_reviews.title: ... lot of research and this wet saw has performed better than I expected
customer_reviews.text: I did a lot of research and this wet saw has performed better than I expected. It is portable enough to be handled by one person. I installed 1500 ft2 of 6"x24" tile in a herringbone pattern and this saw worked perfectly. Accurate cuts and a very stable table.
customer_reviews.author: Joel Krueger

customer_reviews.title: I love this saw
customer_reviews.text: I love this saw. I am a tile contractor and have tried many different wet saws (including the rigid, which I did not like) The dewalt is worth the extra money.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: good saw
customer_reviews.text: I am a carpenter-I only do 2-3 tile jobs a year. This saw has been great for me. Lightweight, good capacity. Four years of use and no problems.If I did a lot of tile work I would want something a little more robust, but so far, so good.
customer_reviews.author: b Ruff

customer_reviews.title: This saw is terrific in every way
customer_reviews.text: This saw is terrific in every way. Can't beat this saw for the price unless you spend thousands and get high end pro tile saw. 5 stars for the saw and 2 stars for Amazons price, cheaper elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Mark W

customer_reviews.title: Good purchase
customer_reviews.text: So far very happy with this purchase. Great saw, easy set up/take down, and storage. A bit lighter than some of the other tile saws I've used. My only concern is the water pump, I'll only get a good stream of water out of one of the hoses. This hasn't bothered the performance as one good stream seems to be enough.
customer_reviews.author: Greg

product_meta.title: DEWALT Wet Tile Saw with Stand, 10-Inch (D24000S)
product_meta.description:
Style:Wet tile saw w/standThe 69-pound D24000S 10" Wet Tile Saw allows a one person set up and transport. Stainless steel rail system is integrated into the tile saw frame, insuring accurate cuts. Rear and side water attachments can be placed on tile saw to catch over-spray from large tile to keep the water in the pan.The D24000S includes a 10" Wet Tile Saw with a stand that folds for easy transporting and storage. The stand holds the 69-pound Wet Tile Saw and provides an ideal work space. Durable aluminum framing and stainless steel rails are built to stand up to the tough jobsite environment. Lightweight folding stand easily sets up on the job and stores in the truck

AMAZON.COM
Light, ultra-powerful, and a breeze to set-up, the D24000S from DEWALT is ideal for renovating bathrooms, cutting porcelain and stone, or tiling a kitchen back splash or floor. The D24000S ships in two boxes and includes the D24000 saw and the D24001 stand. The saw motor tilts and locks at 45 or 22.5 degrees for clean, smooth cuts without the need for an accessory cart block, and adjustable rollers help properly align the table. When tackling large projects, you'll appreciate the 24-inch ripping capacity (18-inch tile on diagonal). To ensure smooth operation, two adjustable water nozzles allow for the correct positioning of spray on the blade, while optional rear and side water attachments capture over-spray so water stays in the five-gallon pan. Additionally, a 3-1/8-inch depth of cut gives you the option of cutting the majority of V-caps and pavers, and an edge guide with dual position 45-degree guide makes it a snap to line-up corner cuts. There's also an efficient 1.5 HP motor, flip-style edge guide for 90 and 45 degree set-up, and a tub-style bottom with four molded sections that fit into the included stand. And because there's a fully integrated durable stainless steel rail system in the saw frame, you'll enjoy precise cuts every time. When you're done for the day, the removable cutting cart gives you better access to the saw so you can clean up quickly and easily.
feature_bullets: Your purchase includes One Dewalt 10-Inch Wet Tile Saw, Wet Tile Saw Stand, 10-Inch XP4 Porcelain Tile Blade, Submersible Pump, Water Pan, Side Water Tray, Rear Water Tray, Cutting Cart Side Extension, Angle/Rip Guide, Blade Wrench & Hex Wrench
Tool dimensions: 36” L x 29” W x 24” H. Tool weight: 69 lbs. Voltage – 120V. Peak Horsepower – 1.5 HP
Other specifications: Arbor Size – 5/8”. Blade Diameter – 10". Diagonal Cut Capacity 18” x 18”. Max depth cut – 3 1/8”. Max Rip Capacity with Plunge – 28”. Bevel Capacity – 45ᵒ
Cutline indicator and stainless steel rollers provide stable, accurate cutting to within 1/32 inch over 18 inch cuts
Compact saw frame allows for easy transport and storage in vehicle

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars601 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
